title: Wesseling on British and Indian Textiles MCQ 4

content.question: Which of the following aspects of the Marxist critique of capitalism would be most useful in understanding why the author of the passage chose to invoke Karl Marx’s thought in the first paragraph?

choices.label: Most Marxists believed that capitalism would be overthrown by a workers’ revolution, and Wesseling is arguing that colonial workers were also beginning to organize for a revolution.
Many Marxists argued that imperialism is the last and final stage of capitalism, and Wesseling’s analysis is premised on the same belief.

Many Marxists criticized imperialism for arresting the economic development of the colonies and reducing them to mere raw material export economies, and Wesseling appears to agree with that criticism.
Some Marxists emphasized imperialism’s positive economic impacts in introducing more modern modes of production into the colonies, and Wesseling seems to agree with that assessment.

content.answer: Many Marxists criticized imperialism for arresting the economic development of the colonies and reducing them to mere raw material export economies, and Wesseling appears to agree with that criticism.
